doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Thoughts on Rockstar sale and strengthened long-term partnership with CELHThoughts on Rockstar sale and strengthened lon_2025-08-29

passages.text: PepsiCo, Inc. PEP | \(146.98 In Line | Target Price/Base Case:\) 150.08 Company Update
Consumer | Global Beverages

This morning, CELH and PEP strengthened their long- term strategic partnership, in which CELH acquired Rockstar and Alani Nu joined PEP's distribution system (see Press Release / Slides). CELH was also designated as PEP's U.S. Strategic Energy Drink Captain. We believe the transaction will help drive better results for the Energy brands and will allow for the company to spend more time and focus on its core CSDs and Stills businesses. CELH highlighted 4 components of strategic rationale:

Increased strategic alignment with PEP and go- to- market strategy Expanded distribution of Alani Nu enhances the brand's availability Addition of Rockstar broadens Celsius' portfolio to serve more people, in more places, more often Financial benefits driving shareholder value creation, with an improved long- term financial structure and cash flow generation as well as aligned incentives

In the deal, CELH issued PEP \(585M of new, non- voting, convertible preferred stock, taking PEP's ownership stake in CELH up to 11%. The transaction is expected to be cash accretive to EPS in its first full year. Capital deployment will focus on successful integration, transition, and debt reduction, with CELH's liquidity position expected to remain robust with ample cash on the balance sheet and a significant cash flow generation profile. Please see below for a deal summary as well as key takeaways from the Q&A:
PEP designates CELH as its U.S. Strategic Energy Drink Captain, strengthening the longterm strategic partnership
CELH will control energy planograms, SKU prioritization, and promotion strategy for all 3 brands PEP will now lead distribution for all 3 CELH brands in the U.S. and Canada
Alani Nu joins PEP's distribution system in the U.S. and Canada
Move is expected to increase Alani Nu's retail availability, including in foodservice and independents in convenience
CELH to manage transition and make buy- out payment to existing distributors, with PEP contributing the funding
Will transition the majority of Alani Nu DSD to PEP's distribution system as of December 1st
Only one month of activity in PEP system prior to YE - don't expect much change in 3Q results vs. commentary from 2Q earnings call
4Q will have tariff pressure and expect to see some inventory write- offs and scrap as the brand transitions, leading to additional margin pressure - write- offs "not extremely material"
Celsius transition also saw increased inventory reserves and write- offs
CELH acquires Rockstar from PEP in the U.S. and Canada
Rockstar incremental to CELH's portfolio, with minimal consumer overlap
- Leans into "bold, high-energy, rebellious persona for all active lifestyles"

- PEP employees currently dedicated to the Rockstar Energy brand will transition to CELH 
- TSAs will be in place from 1 to 7 months; Expect noise in system for the next 3-4 months 
- Brand is expected to be \(\sim \$ 250M+\) in annual sales 
- No significant change to 3Q modeling given the brand is only in the portfolio for 1 month

- CELH issued PEP \(585M of new, non-voting, convertible preferred stock as consideration for the transaction and related agreements  
- Terms of the new, non-voting, convertible preferred stock are substantially consistent with PEP's existing preferred stock, including the right to a \(5\%\) per annum dividend payable in-kind or in cash  
- Shares of common stock underlying the transaction were priced at \$51.75 per share, or approximately 11.3M shares  
- PEP entitled to designate a second director for nomination to CELH's Board
- Energy Drink Captaincy allows for greater strategic control over the portfolio and go-to-market

- Aligns synergies between CELH and PEP  
- Reiterated control over planograms, flavors, SKUs to drive optimal sales performance as well as priority periods throughout the year
- Additional investment and Board seat for PEP aligns the companies and optimizes collaboration

- Model is similar to MNST and KO, which is a proven model  
- PEP is funding the termination fees of moving Alani's distribution
- Anticipate rationalization and optimization of Rockstar's portfolio entering 2026 and shelf resets

- Margin profile will look like Celsius between 2020-2022 â€“ will migrate to Celsius' 2023-2025 profile over the next 12-18 months  
- Brand does really well in the Pacific Northwest, a weaker area for CELH's current portfolio  
- More traditional Energy offering with traditional flavors that does not reach CELH's core consumer base
- Will work to mitigate friction during Alani's transition; Controls and oversight in place to limit disruption
- ABI distributors great partners, with solid working relationships
- Expect the same support from them as when Celsius transitioned into the network
- Received feedback that it was "one of the best transitions" people had seen with lots of positive feedback
- Alani is further developed than Celsius when it entered PEP's distribution system
- Alani Nu Witch's Brew LTO performing very well, with more LTOs planned for 2H

12- month price target is based on 17.5x 2026E P/E

Higher than expected commodity inflation, weaker than expected pricing from higher than expected competitive intensity, greater than expected retailer pushback, or weaker than expected consumer spending, health and wellness concerns or new taxes impacting demand for beverages and snacks, execution on growth initiatives such as energy drinks. Potential headwinds from GLP- 1s
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Time of dissemination: August 29 2025 10:00 AM ET

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.

Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances.

Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
